shorts.title: Charles Hangen Joins Fidelity Bank as Senior Vice President and Chief Risk Officer
shorts.title_distilled: Charles Hangen Joins Fidelity Bank as Senior Vice President and Chief Risk Officer.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Nov. 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Daniel J. Santaniello, President and CEO of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce that Charles Hangen has joined Fidelity Bank as SVP, Chief Risk Officer.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Nov. 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Daniel J. Santaniello, President and CEO of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce that Charles Hangen has joined Fidelity Bank as SVP, Chief Risk Officer.

shorts.title: Gentex Corporation Secures Third Year Option on its Advanced Combat Helmet Generation II Contract Worth $38.4 Million
shorts.title_distilled: Gentex Corporation Secures Third Year Option on its Advanced Combat Helmet Generation II Contract Worth $38.
shorts.description: CARBONDALE, PA, November 13, 2025 — The Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) has exercised the third one-year option period of the Advanced Combat Helmet Generation II (ACH Gen II) production contract (SPE1C1-23-D-0004) awarded to Gentex Corporation. Valued at up t…
shorts.content: CARBONDALE, PA, November 13, 2025 — The Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) has exercised the third one-year option period of the Advanced Combat Helmet Generation II (ACH Gen II) production contract (SPE1C1-23-D-0004) awarded to Gentex Corporation. Valued at up t…
shorts.content_distilled: CARBONDALE, PA, November 13, 2025 — The Defense Logistics Agency  has exercised the third one-year option period of the Advanced Combat Helmet Generation II  production contract  awarded to Gentex Corporation.

shorts.title: Toyota of Scranton supports Scranton Jazz Festival Christmas Spectacular
shorts.title_distilled: Toyota of Scranton supports Scranton Jazz Festival Christmas Spectacular.
shorts.description: Toyota of Scranton is providing support for the Scranton Jazz Festival Christmas Spectacular, Holiday Concert and Toy Drive, scheduled for Sunday, Dec. 7, at 5:30 p.m. at Scranton Preparatory School’s Bellarmine Theatre, 1000 Wyoming Ave., Scranton. Doors open at 5 p.m. Proceeds benefit WRC. People attending are encouraged to bring a toy. From left: Patrick Rogers, CFO, Toyota of Scranton; and Marko Marcinko, founder and director, Scranton Jazz Festival.
shorts.content: Toyota of Scranton is providing support for the Scranton Jazz Festival Christmas Spectacular, Holiday Concert and Toy Drive, scheduled for Sunday, Dec. 7, at 5:30 p.m. at Scranton Preparatory School’s Bellarmine Theatre, 1000 Wyoming Ave., Scranton. Doors open at 5 p.m. Proceeds benefit WRC. People attending are encouraged to bring a toy. From left: Patrick Rogers, CFO, Toyota of Scranton; and Marko Marcinko, founder and director, Scranton Jazz Festival.
shorts.content_distilled: Toyota of Scranton is providing support for the Scranton Jazz Festival Christmas Spectacular, Holiday Concert and Toy Drive, scheduled for Sunday, Dec.

shorts.title: Toyota of Scranton supports Philharmonic’s Holiday Concert
shorts.title_distilled: Toyota of Scranton supports Philharmonic’s Holiday Concert.
shorts.description: Toyota of Scranton is continuing to provide support to the Northeastern Pennsylvania Philharmonic as a sponsor of the 2025 Holiday Concert, scheduled for Saturday, Dec. 6, at 7 p.m. at the Scranton Cultural Center at the Masonic Temple. From left: Patrick Rogers, CFO, Toyota of Scranton; and Chason Goldschmitz, executive director, Northeastern Pennylvania Philharmonic.
shorts.content: Toyota of Scranton is continuing to provide support to the Northeastern Pennsylvania Philharmonic as a sponsor of the 2025 Holiday Concert, scheduled for Saturday, Dec. 6, at 7 p.m. at the Scranton Cultural Center at the Masonic Temple. From left: Patrick Rogers, CFO, Toyota of Scranton; and Chason Goldschmitz, executive director, Northeastern Pennylvania Philharmonic.
shorts.content_distilled: Toyota of Scranton is continuing to provide support to the Northeastern Pennsylvania Philharmonic as a sponsor of the 2025 Holiday Concert, scheduled for Saturday, Dec.

shorts.title: Penguins pick up another win over Lehigh Valley
shorts.title_distilled: Penguins pick up another win over Lehigh Valley.
shorts.description: It’s a new month, but the same result for the Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins against their one of their in-state rivals. The Penguins jumped out to a three-goal lead after two periods, and picked up a 4-1 win over the Lehigh Valley Phantoms on Friday night at Mohegan Arena at Casey Plaza. It’s the third win in as many tries this season over the Phantoms and improves their record to 15-4-1-0. Wilkes-Barre/Scranton now has 31 points, three ahead of the Providence Bruins atop the Atlantic Division standings, and Lehigh Valley (11-6-1-1) remains in third with 24 points, two points ahead of Charlotte. […]
shorts.content: It’s a new month, but the same result for the Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins against their one of their in-state rivals. The Penguins jumped out to a three-goal lead after two periods, and picked up a 4-1 win over the Lehigh Valley Phantoms on Friday night at Mohegan Arena at Casey Plaza. It’s the third win in as many tries this season over the Phantoms and improves their record to 15-4-1-0. Wilkes-Barre/Scranton now has 31 points, three ahead of the Providence Bruins atop the Atlantic Division standings, and Lehigh Valley (11-6-1-1) remains in third with 24 points, two points ahead of Charlotte. […]
shorts.content_distilled: It’s a new month, but the same result for the Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins against their one of their in-state rivals.

shorts.title: Holiday tradition brightens up park with light displays
shorts.title_distilled: Holiday tradition brightens up park with light displays.
shorts.description: SCRANTON, LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — What better way to end Black Friday than loading up into the car with friends and family for a holiday light display? The annual holiday tradition is brightening up Scranton's Nay Aug Park with scenes ranging from the 12 Days of Christmas to Scranton's iconic Electric City sign. The drive-through [...]

shorts.content_distilled: SCRANTON, LACKAWANNA COUNTY  — What better way to end Black Friday than loading up into the car with friends and family for a holiday light display? The annual holiday tradition is brightening up Scranton's Nay Aug Park with scenes ranging from the 12 Days of Christmas to Scranton's iconic Electric City sign.

shorts.title: 5 displaced after Thanksgiving house fire
shorts.description: SCRANTON, LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — A fire in Lackawanna County left at least five people displaced. Crews were called to a fire at a multi-family home on Myrtle Street in Scranton around 8:30 p.m. Thanksgiving night. No injuries were reported, but the Red Cross was requested to help those displaced. The home is now condemned, [...]
shorts.content: SCRANTON, LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — A fire in Lackawanna County left at least five people displaced. Crews were called to a fire at a multi-family home on Myrtle Street in Scranton around 8:30 p.m. Thanksgiving night. No injuries were reported, but the Red Cross was requested to help those displaced. The home is now condemned, [...]
shorts.content_distilled: SCRANTON, LACKAWANNA COUNTY  — A fire in Lackawanna County left at least five people displaced.

shorts.title: Local businesses get ready for Small Business Saturday
shorts.title_distilled: Local businesses get ready for Small Business Saturday.
shorts.description: SCRANTON, LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — As Black Friday shopping winds down, Small Business Saturday is gearing up. The few weeks between Thanksgiving and Christmas can be the most important sales period for small businesses, beginning with Small Business Saturday. Holiday sales are everywhere you look in downtown Scranton. Markups at 10%, 20%, and 30% in [...]
